The pita bread is fresh and the portions served are huge. You rarely see a party leaving without at least one or two containers of leftovers. Many regulars evident. There is a small outdoor dining area. Not sure if its dog friendly, but I suspect it may be only reluctantly.

I don't care for the five dollar fee to split an entre. Most dinner entrees are about fifteen bucks and the serving sizes are large, so sharing is a rationale approach for all but the most robust of appetites. Also don't expect a warm welcome if you try to order portions of the menu al a carte. I think it's fine to bring your kids here, but I don't sense that kids are encouraged. They did throw in extra pita bread upon request with our leftovers on a recent visit. Nice. Any complaints are really very minor in comparison to the strengths of the restaurant. 

This small family owned and operated establishment is definitely worth experiencing.

Love love love this restaurant .  The owners are great.
We went in last week for dinner. We usually take out but decided to order in.   The Lentil soup is the best ever.  We shared a kabob.  We took 2 desserts home. 
It was a great Sunday night.  

We are going to take out tomorrow night!!! 
Yummy. 

Food and service are great!!!!!

One of the best Middle Eastern restaurants I've been to here in Phoenix. I would have given it a 5 star if it wasn't for the fact that they don't turn on the ac or they set it way too high when the owner is there.

Eden's Grill is a gem in Phoenix.  A diamond in the rough if you will.  It's truly a shame there aren't more deliciously amazing family-owned restaurants like this in Phoenix.  

From the moment you walk in you're welcomed by a member of the family, usually the father who is working the dining room.  This hospitality lasts until you leave.

Their rice is truly a standout with almonds and raisins mixed in.  Hummus is amazing.  Chicken kabobs are always tender and juicy.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu here!

If you're nice to them, they might even give you a complimentary baklava for dessert!

I love Eden's Grill Inn.  The food, the owners, the lunch special's....everything!  It is, without a doubt, some of the best Mediterranean food in town.  Their gyros are the real deal. A perfectly prepared pita, lots of seasoned beef and lamb, fresh onion and tomato. A side of creamy goodness and some of the best rice I have laid my lips upon and you've got yourself one mighty fine meal.  The gyros, chicken and beef kebab combination ($33) says it feeds two, but I think it would be more than enough for six NFL players or eight midgets...I mean, little people ( approximately seven average sized humans).  What a smokin' deal!  

Trust me when I tell you that you are doing your self a disservice if you don't check out Eden's.  They will not disapoint!

I got turned onto Eden's Grill when my car club did a group dinner here a couple months ago. I have gone the opposite direction of home from work at least 4 times since to pick up dinner.  The food is ridiculous! The Gyro dinner fed me for 2 extra days.  The Chicken Kebab is all kinds of awesome and feeds me for two days.  I am not normally a rice person regardless of the culture of the food but their rice is fantastic! I literally want to shove the whole plate in my mouth. I have never had Baklava so good.  Only dined in once but the service was great and they are always super friendly when I pick up my #1 to go.

Great lunch special prices.  Went with nephew who suggested it and he was right...good food at very reasonable prices. We had gyros sandwich lunch special with fries and soda for 7.95.
Service was good even though busy for lunch and only 1 server...poor woman was running around taking orders, refilling drinks, cash register and to go orders...what a pro she was.
Portions for gyros were awesomely huge too. Well worth going..I sure am glad I did.

A tiny place in a nondescript strip mall. You wouldn't think to look twice at it but I tell ya...it's AMAZING! Hubby had the lamb special and I had the Moroccan chicken. Both were great but the Moroccan chicken was actually to die for! Portions are HUGE so expect to have leftovers the next day. (I believe it's $5 extra to split  something so just go with having leftovers you won't regret it) I'm not a leftover kinda girl but I hoarded these leftovers like you wouldn't believe. The owner is the cook and the daughter is the waitress. The sweetest women ever. The rest of the staff was fun too!  We had a party of 11 so it could have been a handful but they handled it well and made it fun!  Quick tip. ...the place is tiny so make a reservation if you have a large group. Our group of 11 took up half the restaurant.  :)

Heard great things about this place. When we walked in I became a little worried. It didn't seem family friendly (no kids menu). It was small and kind of quiet. While I was delighted to see "ask about gluten free" on the menu (for me), I also saw "everything comes with rice with almonds and raisins." My son has an egg and nut allergy. But when we asked about cross contamination of nuts in the food, the server confidently assured me there would be no issues. And I believed her whole heartedly. She was a lovely lady and very sweet to my son. The food was fantastic and everything turned out great.

This place was excellent. I brought my elderly grandparents, who aren't big on greek, and they had a great time. The sergice was attentive, and thought was put into every dish. 

Most Greek/Mediterranean places tend to overflavor their food, I thought Eden balanced the flavor of their chicken brilliantly with just a compliment of nice spices. Their salads were fresh, and the falafel was cispy outside and fluffy inside. I would absolutely go back...and congratulations to the owner on opening a nice, quaint business.
I love love their gyros. The lamb is the best by far.  I definitely would recommend this place.  The place is a small hole in the wall type of feel,  but food is amazing.

Food deserves five stars.  Service deserves zero.  The shorter sister is a total a-hole.  I've never had such rude service.  I'm not a big yelper (in fact this is the first review I've ever written), but her inappropriate behavior (like tossing the bill on our table without a word and walking away) and rude comments (like when she asked us if we wanted desert and my boyfriend started telling me that he already had ice cream earlier and she chimed in with "a simple yes or no answer is all I wanted" then walked away looking irritated ???) Makes me never want to go back again.

I did not find this establishment to be as good as the hype/reviews. It certainly was not terrible, but quite mediocre. 
Service was lacking..
....often times the server would be asking me questions about what I want or need from the other side of the room, which is kind of strange and a little unprofessional. The rice had a lot of excess grease. With all of the great options, it is not a place I find worth returning to.

Best food and service in town, my family has been coming here for years now and we can never get enough it's the best food and service you'll find in a Mediterranean restaurant. The food is truly as authentic as can be and the atmosphere warm and cozy, they really know how to make you feel apart if the family. Definitely recommend this place anytime for any occasion.

At first, I was skeptical that this place was going to be another over-prices Mediterranean restaurant.  The options on the menu are nothing different than any other at first blush. But the difference is in the dolmehs! The serving sizes are very generous. The rice is delicious. The dolmehs and hummus were both amazing! 
I had the gyros. My dinner mates had the Eden Chicken and the the Lamp/Chicken kabob combo. We had leftovers for lunch the next day. I even got a cucumber sauce to go without asking.

Bar none the best Middle Eastern food in Arizona. It is truly home-cooked because the cook is "mama" in this family owned restaurant. Portions are very generous but also so delicious you have to try it to know what I am saying. This past weekend we catered my son's 18th birthday party with Eden. The food was every bit as delicious as when we come to eat at the restaurant. Very charming spot nice for a date any night of the week. The regular clientele speaks for itself.

Loved the food in the little neighborhood shopping center.
The people that own the restaurant are delightful and very
helpful.
It's busy and well worth the trip from Scottsdale.
We've been there twice and plan to return.

The food is better than when it's busy. It is priced very reasonably and the portions are generous. This is not a place for a romantic diner. It doesn't have that type of atmosphere. The atmosphere is quaint, with a few small tables scattered in the small dining area. No class but decent food.  
The beef in the kabobs are hit or miss for each piece. You may get pieces that are really tough and others that are tender. Not sure that they are cooked to order; If you order medium then some pieces are well done, while others are bloody inside. The rice is great and always a big hit.
It is not unique in any sense as Mediterranean restaurants go but nice to have as an alternative to some others.

Love! Love! Love this place. The dining room may not look like much but the food is incredible. Family owned with great service and huge portions of food. If you like Mediterranean food, stop in and try it. It will change your life.

I hate to give this place 2.5 stars. But I am. I believe half of the experience is the food, the other half is the service. The food is definitely 5 star quality, but the service is terrible. I've been here many times and have had some good service, but there are times when I get an extremely rude server/hostess. It's quite uncomfortable. I'd love to keep coming here for the amazing food, but not if the waitstaff treats their customers as if they are a total bother. I also really don't want to see any eye-rolling because our party of two hasn't decided on a meal after being seated for two seconds!  If you frequent here enough, you will witness this. No thanks.

If you want some of the greatest Greek/Mediterranean food, go here! Their yellow rice with cranberry and almonds is so delicious and also very hard to impossible to find at other Greek restaurants at this quality. Everything I've tried here is just amazing. The environment is nice and quaint and they have all the awards they've won on the wall for customers to look at. The service is usually good, sometimes you can tell when the waitress is having a bad day but we all have bad days right? But they do recognize you if you come in often so it's nice when they treat you like regulars. Love this place! Haven't found a replacement for Edens Grill since I left Phoenix just because of their amazing rice!

Eden's is a classic mom and pop American story. Immigrated from Iraq this family is born to make delicious food. The mom has a super secret recipe for rice which she will pass on to her children only through her will.  The sister is kind, warm and knowledgeable. The brother is the brains and the cool who does a great job. He's always creating new dishes to push your tastebuds. Very authentic food. Good food. Great people.

Outstanding Middle eastern cooking!  Vegetable platter was delicious.  Little atmosphere but the service is very friendly and helpful and the food is excellent.  One of our favorites.  Well worth the one hour drive from Surprise.
